page.title: 18Forest walks
page.content: The{Winding Walks}form part of the {Speymouth Forest}and are situated on the{A98. Towards the end of the nineteenth century the{Duke of Gordon & Richmond had footpaths and bridges built and planted rhododendrons and conifers but, after the First World War, there was a drop in local interest in the Walks. The general lack of repair was not helped when the{Great Gale of 1953 badly damaged sections of the forest and it was not unitl 1972, after repair work done by a group from {Gordonstoun School,}that the Walks were reopened. There are a variety of walks, the most popular taking walkers to{The Peeps,}a viewpoint from which Fochabers and the surrounding countryside can be seen.
